content: For every nation where insecurity is a major challenge it won't be out of place to say the leadership from the executive arm, the legislative arm down to the Judiciary is compromised. The worst situation any nation should find them selves is falling into the arms of wrong and unproductive leadership. With bad leadership comes economic crisis, excessive and unaccountable taxation, static growth, low GDP, poor return on investments and the most killing factor is high inflation rate which uncontrollably result in high cost of living.Insecurity is highly transmitted in countries where government policies, decisions and tussle gets so tough and where the populace are left with no option but to seek a means of survival. Majority of societal nemesis can be traced to how people are been treated and how the struggle to survive. Many who engage in criminal activities were left with no choice, Some might have tried all sorts of legal ventures but due to little or no result switched to illegal ventures.Pushing of hard drugs, ammunition, deadly weapons, and illegal processing of natural resource has over the years been a means by which people survived in a society of poor leadership and with each passing year it has become a norm such that even the law enforcement agencies overlook this perpetrators as long has they too benefit from the process. And from all that is going around the world there might never come a time when illegality will reduce rather it will be reserved for the elites and their subordinates. And legal actions taken against the lesser citizens.

comments.author: Zlantann
comments.body: Quote from: dbc23 on March 22, 2023, 06:32:44 AMFor every nation where insecurity is a major challenge it won't be out of place to say the leadership from the executive arm, the legislative arm down to the Judiciary is compromised. The worst situation any nation should find them selves is falling into the arms of wrong and unproductive leadership. With bad leadership comes economic crisis, excessive and unaccountable taxation, static growth, low GDP, poor return on investments and the most killing factor is high inflation rate which uncontrollably result in high cost of living.Insecurity could be caused by internal or external factors. Internally insecurity can be caused by poor economic conditions and political agitations. When there is high rate of unemployment and bad economic conditions, many people will turn to crime to survive the economic hardships.External forces such as other countries could decide to destabilize the political or economic sector of a nation because of some reasons. Some powerful nations can instigate political crisis in a country because they want to sell arms and ammunition or take the market share of a country. Some insecurity can be caused by the ripple effect of war in neighboring countries. The war in Libya have caused so much insecurity in some African countries.Political agitations such as the rise of sucessionist groups like we see in Ethiopia, Cameroon and Nigeria are offshoots of the failure of government to uphold the fundamental human rights of citizens, tribalism and lack of respect for rule of law. This has made some tribes or regions in some of these countries to seek greater autonomy and even independence.QuoteInsecurity is highly transmitted in countries where government policies, decisions and tussle gets so tough and where the populace are left with no option but to seek a means of survival. Majority of societal nemesis can be traced to how people are been treated and how the struggle to survive. Many who engage in criminal activities were left with no choice, Some might have tried all sorts of legal ventures but due to little or no result switched to illegal ventures. Pushing of hard drugs, ammunition, deadly weapons, and illegal processing of natural resource has over the years been a means by which people survived in a society of poor leadership and with each passing year it has become a norm such that even the law enforcement agencies overlook this perpetrators as long has they too benefit from the process. And from all that is going around the world there might never come a time when illegality will reduce rather it will be reserved for the elites and their subordinates. And legal actions taken against the lesser citizens.Poor economic conditions should not be an excuse to engage in criminal activities. The people that suffer from these criminal activities are not the corrupt government officials but the poor masses. We must not embrace crime because the government is bad. Citizens must seek for alternative legal means to survive. And we must engage in activities like constructive criticism and peaceful protest to oppose bad governance. If you also have the means or opportunity, you can seek greener pastures in other countries that are friendly to immigrants.
